name: Questions On 'Some Like it Hot' Quiz | Movies | 10 Questions

questions.text: Whose murder do the two guys, Joe and Jerry, witness?
questions.explanation:
Toothpick Charlie.

	Toothpick Charlie is a member of Little Bonaparte's gang, and he was killed by Spats Columbo's rival outfit.

questions.text: 'Josephine' is a saxophonist; what instrument does 'Daphne' play?
questions.explanation:
Double bass.

	Its bullet holes from the murder that give the guys away.

questions.text: How does the all girls' band leave Chicago?
questions.explanation:
Train.

	They go by train, leading to some classic scenes as the 'girls' swap bunks. Also sets up Marilyn Monroe's first appearance as Sugar Kane, dodging the steam from the train.

questions.text: 'Daphne' ends up dating a millionaire. What is his name?
questions.explanation:
Osgood.

	His full name is Osgood Fielding III. He comes complete with yacht, expensive habits and a demanding mother.

questions.text: Joe pretends to be a millionaire to woo Sugar; what does he claim to be heir to?
questions.explanation:
Shell Oil.

	He picks up a shell on the beach, saying his grandfather liked shells so much, he named the company after one.

questions.text: What gift does 'Daphne' get from her suitor, although it ends up with Sugar?
questions.explanation:
Diamond bracelet.

	Joe hides them in an orchid for Sugar as a gift when he has to leave her.

questions.text: The mob turns up at the resort where the 'girls' are playing, at a convention party called the Friends of _______________ what?
questions.explanation:
Italian Opera.

	The Chicago cop tailing them says he is there in case any of them decide to sing...

questions.text: What does her 'fiance' say when 'Daphne' reveals she is a man?
questions.explanation:
'Nobody's perfect.'

	The scriptwriters agonized over a last line but this casual response to what should be shocking news works just right.

questions.text: Who did the studio originally want for Jerry, the Jack Lemmon role?
questions.explanation:
Frank Sinatra.

	They thought Jack Lemmon might not be a big enough name, but he was perfect in the role.

questions.text: Tony Curtis is rumoured to have said that kissing Marilyn Monroe was like kissing who?
questions.explanation:
Hitler.

	Marilyn Monroe's behaviour was unpredictable and she took dozens of takes for her simplest scenes, so this drove her co-stars mad. She also had a miscarriage during filming. Tony Curtis now denies he went as far as comparing her to Hitler, despite the stories.
